intro: Peristylus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive spotted pattern on the underside. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Peristylus maculatus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
